poem:
### The Turning Tide

In halls where echoes whispered change,  
a pen erased what voices framed;  
where banners bold of promise waved,  
now silence fills the metalled grave.  
The tide retreats from common ground,  
leaving high and dry the drowned,  
yet in the hollow of retreat,  
new seeds stir beneath our feet.
